title: Boris Johnson 'must convince Donald Trump to save 3,000 Scottish jobs by dumping malt whisky tariff'
text:
Boris Johnson must use his friendship with Donald Trump to save thousands of Scottish jobs by convincing the US President to scrap tariffs on single malt whisky, a former Scottish Secretary has argued.

David Mundell warned 3,000 jobs and £228 million of revenue could be lost if the Trump administration presses ahead with the introduction next week of a 25 per cent trade tariff on Scotch, following a dispute with the EU over aircraft subsidies.

Asking an urgent question in the Commons, he cited the figures as industry estimates of the losses that could be incurred and said Mr Johnson must "intervene directly" with Mr Trump.
